hotspots.label: Structure and Function
hotspots.fact: The centipede's segmented body and numerous legs are specialized structures. The legs provide speed for hunting, while the antennae serve as primary sensory organs in dark environments.

hotspots.label: Segmented Body
hotspots.fact: This centipede represents a predator that has evolved specific physical structures to thrive in its niche. The segmentation allows for extreme flexibility, enabling the creature to navigate tight crevices in soil or wood.

hotspots.label: Curved Tail with Stinger
hotspots.fact: It uses its antennae to sense vibrations and chemical signals from prey, then utilizes its modified front legs (forcipules) to deliver venom.

hotspots.label: Ecosystem Roles
hotspots.fact: As a predator of insects and spiders, the centipede plays a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the local food web.
